title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, addressing themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, depicting government surveillance and control.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel exploring themes of love, reputation, and social class in 19th century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic story of love, wealth, and social status set in the 1920s.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A whaling voyage becomes an obsession for revenge against a giant white whale.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A complex narrative depicting Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story of teenage rebellion and alienation in mid-20th century America.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian society focused on technological advancements and societal control.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A young woman's journey of self-discovery and independence.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of crime, guilt, and redemption.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantastical adventure of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, on a quest to reclaim treasure from a dragon.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark and passionate tale of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic following Odysseus' long journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A monumental novel exploring themes of justice, redemption, and revolution in 19th-century France.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A gothic horror novel that introduced Count Dracula and the vampire legend.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A cautionary tale about science, ambition, and the consequences of creating life.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: A medieval epic exploring the afterlife through Inferno, Purgatorio, and Paradiso.
